events.body:
Nice, ACK

Maybe add:

```
To enable block pruning set `prune=N` on the command line or in bitcoin.conf, 
where N is the number of MB to allot for raw block & undo data.
```

ACK

On Monday, 18 January 2016, Wladimir J. van der Laan <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Nice, ACK
> 
> Maybe add:
> 
> To enable block pruning set `prune=N` on the command line or in bitcoin.conf,
> where N is the number of MB to allot for raw block & undo data.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7370#issuecomment-172554993.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,13 @@ sanity check. Since 0.12, these are no longer stored. When loading a
 0.12 wallet into an older version, it will automatically rescan to avoid
 failed checks.
 
+Wallet: Pruning
+---------------
+
+With 0.12 it is possible to use basic wallet functionality in prunded mode.
comments.body: I think we should remove `basic`. Expect of the import and rescan features, you can use everything. `Basic` may imply that only a smaller subset of functions are available.
